channel.title: Question
channel.description: Are there things you should take into account before starting an own rsps?

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[ul][li]You're going to be dealing with a lot of immature people[/li][/ul]
Not really. You are more likely to (start off with) people that will be looking for staff and are acting [i]more[/i] mature than they actually are.
[ul][li]Your server is going to be attacked and hacked and messed with[/li][/ul]
This almost 100% depends on how you program your server. Most of the "hacks" are just poorly programmed checks. As for being attacked, I assume you mean DDOS attacks. You probably won't when you're starting out, because nobody cares about your server.
[ul][li]A lot of people will join, run to the bank, close the client and never come back[/li][/ul]
Not much argument here. But a lot of people will also look for interesting players, I.E. You, the owner, in the very beginning, so welcome your very first players is a good idea.
[ul][li]It's not going to gain a massive following, the community will always be changing[/li][/ul]
The community's tastes have remained the same for the past few years, at least as far as I have noticed, they aren't changing as often as you make it out to be.

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @CSharp95 CSharp95
item.description:
@CSharp95 wrote:

It’s subjective, but to me

[ul][li]You’re going to be dealing with a lot of immature people[/li]
[li]Your server is going to be attacked and hacked and messed with[/li]
[li]A lot of people will join, run to the bank, close the client and never come back[/li]
[li]It’s not going to gain a massive following, the community will always be changing[/li][/ul]

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“mod eldest, post:7, topic:551056”]Lets do some RSPS math, eh?

Money bags + Project Insanity + some tutorials + Advertising + paid off developers = Successful RSPS [size=12pt]cough[/size] [size=8pt][font=comic sans ms]soulsplit[/font][/size] [size=12pt]cough[/size]

–

Don’t get too serious about private servers. You can’t get too far into them before Jagex gets in your business, so try to start writing your own games before you take RSPS seriously

And how well has that worked out for ya?[/quote]
It has been working great thanks for asking

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:2, topic:551056”]Main issues (imo):

[ul][li] RSPS community is dying if not dead already[/li]
[li] Once you have a community, it can become a hassle to put out frequent updates[/li]
[li] Getting a decent amount of players is difficult[/li]
[li] Advertising is costly and may not produce as much as you’d wish[/li]
[li] DDoS protection, donations, hosting and any other services you will be using might fail from time to time[/li][/ul][/quote]
Seems as if the rsps community is dead if you’re not involved with it. I left mopar + r-s for 2 yearsish, thought mopar was dead etc (kinda is) but rsps are not. Although people don’t program to learn or anything now it’s all about fucking money which sucks.

Still a lot of people left wanting to learn and stuff, but the new generation of fgts suck.

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

You should be able to look at your server and feel like what you have produced is unique compared to the other 99% of the servers nowadays.
